title: My Nav-Menu is supposed to move off screen when closed, but instead shifts to the right and extends the screen
description: I created a nav menu which is supposed to move off screen to the right when I close it, and return back on screen when I click the menu button. However, in the opened state, it is in the expected position on screen, but when I close it, instead of disappearing to the right, it shifts to the right zooming the whole screen out and revealing a white space at the bottom of the screen. I tried moving it to the left side instead and that seems to work just fine, I'm a beginner at this stuff and very confused now.

title: Why does this javascript code loop endlessly?
description: When I run the following function, it loops endlessly. Where's the problem?
content:
function GenerateShape() {
  Getevenodd = Evenodd(); //-------Get odd or even value

  h = heightlimit + 1;
  while (h > heightlimit) {
    //Get random height
    h = Math.floor(Math.random() * 10 + 1);
  }
  ChristmasTree.innerHTML = "The h is " + h;

  for (i = 0; i < h; i++) {
    w = shapelimit + 1;
    while (w > shapelimit) {
      //Get random shape
      w = Math.floor(Math.random() * 10 + 1);
    }
    ChristmasTree.innerHTML = "The w is " + w;

    randomshape = w;
    if (randomshape == 1) {
      Body1(Getevenodd);
      Rectan(Getevenodd);
    } else if (randomshape == 2) {
      Body2(Getevenodd);
      Rectan(Getevenodd);
    } else if (randomshape == 3) {
      Doublemirror();
      Rectan(Getevenodd);
    }
  }
  treeleg(Getevenodd);
}
